title: Triangle Area Explorer
creator: Claude Code with microsim-p5 skill
subject: Geometry
description: An interactive exploration tool for understanding how base and height affect triangle area through the formula A = ½bh. Students manipulate sliders to adjust dimensions and observe real-time area calculations.
learningObjectives: Students will apply the triangle area formula A = ½bh to calculate areas with different dimensions
Students will analyze the relationship between base, height, and area
Students will understand that height must be perpendicular to the base
Students will predict how changing dimensions affects area
prerequisites: Understanding of units and square units

controls.name: Base Length Slider
controls.description: Adjusts the length of the triangle's base

controls.name: Height Slider
controls.description: Adjusts the perpendicular height of the triangle

controls.name: Reset Button
controls.description: Resets base and height to default values

parameters.name: triangleHeight
parameters.purpose: Perpendicular height from base to apex

assumptions: Height is always perpendicular to base
Triangle vertices remain within visible canvas
limitations: Does not show other triangle properties (angles, perimeter)
Does not cover triangle classification types

suggestedActivities: Pattern discovery: observe effects of doubling dimensions
Area challenge: find multiple base/height combinations for same area
Proportional reasoning: relationship between dimension and area changes
assessmentOpportunities: Predict area changes from dimension changes
Identify base and height from triangle diagrams
Solve for unknown dimension given area and one dimension
commonMisconceptions: Height can be measured at any angle (must be perpendicular)
Doubling both dimensions doubles area (actually quadruples)
Formula is bh instead of ½bh
discussionQuestions: Why is the formula ½bh instead of just bh?
What happens to area if you double both base and height?
Can two triangles with different dimensions have the same area?
How is triangle area related to rectangle area?

standardsAlignment: CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.6.G.A.1 - Find the area of triangles and polygons
CCSS.MATH.CONTENT.7.G.B.6 - Solve real-world problems involving area
